snippet: Over 7,000 city students are learning in trailers, which were intended to be a temporary solution to crowded schools but are a testament to the struggle to keep up with teeming neighborhoods.
abstract: New York City still has over 7,000 students, most of them in beginning grades, being taught in 'transportable classroom units,' or trailers; new Schools Chancellor Carmen Farina has vowed to rid the schools of trailers within five years, but she is also trying to find space for thousands more students expected to enter the system as Mayor Bill de Blasio expands prekindergarten.
lead_paragraph: Over 7,000 city students are learning in trailers, which were intended to be a temporary solution to crowded schools but are a testament to the struggle to keep up with teeming neighborhoods.

headline.main: Push to Rid City of Classrooms That Are Anything but Temporary
headline.print_headline: Push to Rid City of Classrooms That Are Anything but Temporary
